com.lukflug.panelstudio.hud

Class HUDPanel<T extends IFixedComponent>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lukflug.panelstudio.component.DraggableComponent<HUDPanel.HUDPanelComponent>
      • com.lukflug.panelstudio.hud.HUDPanel<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the component type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IComponentProxy<HUDPanel.HUDPanelComponent>, IFixedComponent, IPopup

    public class HUDPanel<T extends IFixedComponent>
extends DraggableComponent<HUDPanel.HUDPanelComponent>
    Panel containing an HUD component.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  HUDPanel.HUDPanelComponent
      Panel wrapper that conditionally renders the panel itself, but not its content.

                IToggleable state,
                Animation animation,
                ITheme theme,
                IBoolean renderState,
                int border)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        component - the component to be wrapped
        state - the boolean state to be passed to the theme
        animation - the animation for opening and closing
        theme - the theme to be used
        renderState - whether to render the panel title and outline
        border - the component border

      • handleButton

        public void handleButton(Context context,
                         int button)
        Description copied from interface: IComponent
        Should be called by the parent when a mouse button state changes. The current height of the component should be set by this method via Context.setHeight(int).
        Parameters:
        context - the Context for the component
        button - the button that changed its state
        See Also:
        IInterface.LBUTTON, IInterface.RBUTTON

      • handleScroll

        public void handleScroll(Context context,
                         int diff)
        Description copied from interface: IComponent
        Should be called by the parent when the mouse wheel is scrolled. The current height of the component should be set by this method via Context.setHeight(int).
        Parameters:
        context - the Context for the component
        diff - the amount by which the wheel was moved
